embeds.title: Stasis Field
embeds.description:
Rare Skill / 1 :energy_guardian: / The Guardian / Downfall

Gain 6 (8) **Block** :p_block:.
Place this into Stasis
When this leaves Stasis, gain 6 (8) **Block** :p_block:.

messages.content: this with <bottled anomaly> is op

embeds.title: Bottled Anomaly
embeds.description:
Shop Relic / All / Downfall

Upon pickup, choose a card. At the start of each combat, remove it from your draw pile. At the start of turn 3, add it into your hand. It costs 0.
*Swirling and swirling and finally breaking.*

messages.content: at the cost of 1 stasis slot you get 12(16) block per turn
I very much enjoy this card. It's so good, even with the general stasis nerf.
pretty damn good block card
any accelerate makes this card very strong
as well as scaling some dexterity
it's a piece of a complete block system
12(16) block every other turn is pretty good

A fantastic mitigation tool that can become part of a block engine with enough accelerate. This can feel like having some strange variant of horn cleat that keeps proccing every other turn, that also scales with your dexterity. Can be a bit of a stasis slot hog, so prioritize grabbing time capacitor, stasis strike, or cryo chamber to give yourself more room. It really shines in the lategame, but is still quite good even as a neow bonus in act 1. Pairs very nicely with stasis engine, letter opener, ink bottle, and floating orbs. You definitely want to grab emerald and debuff removal cards as well to scale your dexterity with this. The upgrade is very strong, since you will be playing this every other turn at a minimum, and you get +4 block every time it leaves stasis and you replay it for 0. 

If I'm honest, this card makes very little sense to me. It so incredibly strong on it's own, and can become completely broken with a bit of support, which can come from several different places. It almost definitely should be nerfed, because I can't imagine a situation where I'm not thrilled to add this to my deck. Sure, there are a decent number of rares like that in the base game, but most of those are single use exhaust cards. I think the upgrade should probably only be a +1 considering that it applies twice, or you could lower the base block value down to 5 like a defend.
It was already nerfed with the general stasis nerf, where putting stasised 0-cost cards resets the timer to as if it was at full cost.
that's been how stasis works as long as I've played guardian
just confuse to 0 cost ez
though i don’t pick guardian much on snecko

I recall cards that say "Place this into stasis" only being in there for 1 turn after already going through stasis before, regardless of what the original cost was. Likewise with cards that were placed into Stasis through <Rebound>.

embeds.title: Rebound
embeds.description:
Common Attack / 1 :blue_energy: / The Defect / Slay the Spire

Deal 9 (12) damage.
Put the next card you play this turn on top of your draw pile.

messages.content: Er.
<Reroute>

embeds.title: Reroute
embeds.description:
Common Attack / 1 :energy_guardian: / The Guardian / Downfall

Deal 9 (12) damage.
Place the next card you play this turn into **Stasis.**
[ **Socket** ]

messages.content: that may have been a different effect causing that
Every time?
oh i think i know
I don't know what that "other effect" could possibly have been.
when you put a stasis'd card back into stasis without playing it, it goes in for 1 turn
but when you use reroute, that plays the card, un-discounting it
same goes for cards that put themselves into stasis
i _wish_ they went back in for 0, then <fierce bash> would finally be good lol
